intro: Cottendorfia dyckioides, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is the clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Cottendorfia dyckioides is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
